name: LLM-as-Judge Evaluator
description: Using LLMs as Judges for evaluating outputs of other LLMs
_dataset_display_message: Please upload a dataset file with columns: 'input', 'output', 'expected_output'. The context column is optional if using metrics which don't require it.

generation_model.title: Model which will act as Judge LLM

tasks.title: GEval Tasks
tasks.description: Define custom evaluation tasks for evaluation

description.title: Text Description of the Eval providing step by step descriptions for the eval

evaluation_steps.title: Evaluation Steps
evaluation_steps.description: Detailed steps for the evaluation process

predefined_tasks.ui:help: Select one or more evaluation metrics from the drop-down list

generation_model.ui:help: Select the LLM model to be used as Judge

limit.ui:help: Enter a fraction of samples to evaluate from your data. Set as 1 to get all samples

geval_name.ui:help: Enter the name of the criteria. To be used only for GEval

geval_context.ui:help: Enter the description of the criteria. To be used only for GEval

context_geval.ui:help: Select if the `context` field should be considered in the dataset. To be used only for GEval

tasks.ui:help: For each task, provide a clear introduction (what the evaluation is about) and either detailed evaluation criteria in the description field or step-by-step evaluation steps (or both). Example: Name: 'Factual Accuracy', Description: 'Evaluate if the output is factually correct based on the provided context. Consider only verifiable facts.' For more details and best practices, see: https://www.confident-ai.com/blog/g-eval-the-definitive-guide

dataset_split.ui:help: Select the dataset split to evaluate the model on
